alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May; Coastal Atlantic; Cumberland; Southeastern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 3:05PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Atlantic, southeastern Cumberland, Cape May and southeastern Burlington Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 304 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mauricetown to Cape May. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Atlantic City, Ocean City, Cape May, Cumberland, Pleasantville, Somers Point, Ventnor City, Brigantine, Northfield, Absecon, Margate City, Egg Harbor City, North Wildwood, Laurel Lake, Wildwood Crest, Woodbine, Sea Isle City, Estell Manor, Avalon and Port Republic. This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 0 and 54. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 0 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southern New Jersey.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic; Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May; Coastal Atlantic; Cumberland; Southeastern Burlington
